intro: Pachylobus klaineanus, commonly known as the African star-of-Bethlehem, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its striking, star-shaped white flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant has strap-like, grassy leaves that are typically evergreen, and it produces an underground bulb that stores nutrients. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and containers.
